meanings.definition: Match or surpass (a person or achievement), typically by imitation.
meanings.sent1: She tried to emulate her older sister's success in school.
meanings.sent2: The young artist wanted to emulate the famous painters of the past.
meanings.sent3: The little boy decided to emulate his cat by napping in the sun.
meanings.sent4: The student aimed to emulate the speed of a cheetah in completing the race.
meanings.sent5: In order to win the competition, he knew he had to emulate the champion's strategy.

meanings.sent1: The children tried to emulate the dance moves they saw on TV.
meanings.sent2: Art students often emulate the styles of famous painters to learn.
meanings.sent3: The parrot attempted to emulate the sound of a ringing phone.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter could emulate the sound of a bubbling brook.
meanings.sent5: To improve his writing, he decided to emulate the structure of his favorite author's novels.

meanings.definition: Strive to equal or match, especially by imitating.
meanings.sent1: The team worked hard to emulate their opponents' level of skill.
meanings.sent2: She wanted to emulate her mother's cooking by following her recipes.
meanings.sent3: The robot tried to emulate human emotions but ended up looking silly.
meanings.sent4: His determination to emulate his role model was as strong as a raging river.
meanings.sent5: The actor's performance was so convincing, it seemed to emulate real-life events.
